sourceMeaningMnemonic: In the <radical>tree</radical> <radical>district</radical> of town you can buy a lot of tree products, including doors. With those doors, though, you always need <kanji>hinge</kanji>s.
meaningInfo: Don't forget to buy a hinge. Your door purchase will <kanji>hinge</kanji> on your hinges.
readingMnemonic: You buy an awesome <kanji>hinge</kanji> and try it out. Instead of working properly, it just falls apart and the door falls on you, crushing your lower body. You yell out (and you have to yell) "I'm GOING TO <reading>SUUUUEEE</reading> (<ja>すう</ja>) YOU!"
readingInfo: Really lengthen out that "sue" because it's a long "suu" for the reading and that will help.
